title: Grading System...
body:
The grading system is so Bs... I can't get a normal S.
16/0/6 on Lucian and I get a B+.. http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/141333055/200038995?tab=overview
40/2/5 on Vayne in 25mins , Plus a pentakill and I get a S-... http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/141124496/200038995?tab=overview
22/8/11 on Vayne, and I get a A+... http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/141245490/200038995?tab=overview
24/10/14 on Vayne, and I get a A... http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/141281166/200038995?tab=overview
27/7/7 on Rengar, and I get a S-

But I get a S for 18/3/12.... http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/140475536/200038995?tab=overview

replies.body:
CS comes into calculation, aswell as the role you played that champ in.
I assume you played bot with vayne when you scored those? If you got that score in mid, top or jg with vayne it would most likely have been a definite S or S+, I would imagine.
Seems to me like they base your score off the generic meta for that specific champ. You play a champ where they are usually played, you gotta be perfect for a perfect score.
You play a champ in an off role, it's seen as a harder feat therefore a decent score reflects the difficulty you should have had for that game.

Side note, some good games you've had there. I could only dream of achieving 40 kills in a single game haha

Yeah I have been Vayne in the top lane alot recently. 
The game was weird their bot wasn't very good in learning from their mistakes..

from what I've observed farming S's recently for higher mastery and hextech, getting S's is easier in normals and is mostly decided by 3 factors, the % of the total kills on your team that you have, the number of deaths you have (try to keep this to at most 1) and your cs (especially if you are support for some reason).

if you want S's my advice is to make sure you take all the kills you can unless you are sup with the changes (in which case just take 4+2*(#deaths) kills ) and at the very least have an assist for 3/4's of your teams kills. Also try to have at least 140cs in a 20min game, 180cs in a 30min and 200cs in a 40min. If you are sup have at least half this number too.
This seems to be sufficient to get an S with basically any champion and basically involves alot of being a selfish asshole and not caring for your teammates. I'd advise you pair up with someone who is really low elo or unranked and enter normals as a duo though since this will make the enemies easy to wail on and it's not as bad to be selfish at this level since bad players expect this sort of stuff and probably won't report you for being selfish. Also at this level if you ks alot; so long as you carry hard (and seeing those scores I'd imagine you would) they won't begrudge you too much if you are friendly in chat.
Thanks a lot for this. I appreciate the help
from my experience, it is mostly about cs
You're probably not meeting the cs requirements, although I agree that if you go 40/2, you should get S+ regardless of your cs.
instead of farming minions he got bored and farmed champions.
Apparently Riot basis the grading system on how well other people play that particular champion in the same elo as you lmao.

its not how much kills you get, its actually based on how you play the game, the move and combo that you use.
i actually got s on yasuo 6/8/4 with the cs of 200+ in 30min.

League cannot calculate your combos, and moves within the game...
and I seriously doubt you got a S with that score

Haha, I feel bad for you bro. I would be extremely pissed if I went 40/2 and got an S-. I recently carried as Shaco and went 7/1/8 and I got a B-. The grading system is so rigged right now, and now that grades actually do matter for champion masteries they need to fix it. If it is level 6 or 7 masteries your trying to get though, don't worry, you'll get it eventually :)
